description: From Latin concoctiō (“digestion”), from con- (“together”) and coquō (“cook”).

verbs.description: concoct (third-person singular simple present concocts, present participle concocting, simple past and past participle concocted)

entries.meaning: To prepare something by mixing various ingredients, especially to prepare food for cooking.
(figurative) To contrive something using skill or ingenuity.

examples: For the parts of an Embryo are nourished and encreased before it hath a Stomach to concoct any thing, and yet in a perfect Fœtus none can deny that the Stomach does concoct  […]
